comments.commentBody: This seems more like a comment for the Well Blog.
They chose to break up themselves when some illegally crossed into our country, leaving other members behind.

These are not just some "guys" breaking into our home. Your analogy proves my point that if something they claim to value doesn't conveniently fit their ideal, then they simply rename it.

But to run with your analogy, the more accurate scenario is one of illegally hiring a live-in housekeeper without doing a background check and then after she has a baby, and getting caught, telling her to go back where she came from, but leave the child behind. Come to think of it, that scenario isn't even an analogy - it really happens way too much.

The only reason these "guys" break into our home is because Republicans hire them ..... ILLEGALLY. Let's face it, if Republicans were law-abiding, no one would come here illegally because no one would hire them. Simple as that.

Either way, it is immoral to break up families regardless of who broke which law. These are not violent criminals, they just want to survive.

You don't seem to get it. This has nothing to do with politics. It teased the question of law. If I entered Mexico even by mistake I would be locked up in jail and used as an instrument to extract money with no guarantee of release. Think about it!

I'd like to take you to the packaging company here that hires them by the hundreds to pack batteries and other goods in plastic clamshells. And these two owners aren't Republicans based on the conversations we've had and their posters on the walls.
Or the three maid services I have as customers who don;t have a single non-Hispanic empoyee and these three franchisees aren't Republicans either.
Entrepreneurship isn't just for Republicans.

Judging by the comments, this article was immediately picked up by the right-wing media.

I wonder what these "Republicans" would think of the unconstitutional executive actions Lincoln took (contrary to his inaugural statements) to free humans from slavery in the U.S. Probably just come up with more lame technicalities.

What is hard to accept is that the party of family values doesn't value desperate families from other countries.

Don't let 5 million more families be broken up because of politics!
Can you show me a program in place to deport 10-20 million folk?   There is no such effort.  But hey when do facts ever matter to folk like you?

Unfortunately President Obama's proposed actions extend far beyond either a pardon or reprive within the legal intrepretation of the article of the Constitution to which you refer. Based upon published reports on the yet to be announced executive orders regarding deportations, President Obama plans to simply not prosecute certain classes of undocumented foreigners. This is an exercise of prosecutorial discretion rather than pardon or reprive.

While certain undocumented foreigners, currently subject to deportation orders will not be deported as a formal reprive, a far larger number of undocumented foreigners will simply not be subject to a adminstrative deportation process. I am waiting to learn is how President Obama and his advisors will recharacterize his prosecutorial discretion in an instance involving millions of undocumented foreigners to meet established legal precedents governing any law enforcement entity's use of such discretion.

Prior court rulings have held the exercise of prosecutorial discretion cannot breach the level of wholesale unilateral abandonment of the prosecuting authority's sworn duty to faithfully execute the law. It cannot be exercised in a manner which acts as a nullification of the underlying statutes duly enacted by the legislature. The Republicans will probably seek a federal court order finding President Obama's actions are an abuse of his prosecutorial discretion. President Obama will then be under court orders resume deportations.

Once a forced action takes place many if not most of the rest will self deport. It's a choice of going peacefully and setting up a new home or getting picked up and dumped in your homeland with nothing.

All it takes is changing the messaging, something the Obamites know well how to do. Right now we are sending the message that amnesty is coming and there has been no better time in the last 25 years to hop the border and come in.

To Kurfco.
Actually amnesty is not being offered.
What the President proposes is issuing work permits for 5 million persons who are here illegally.

Note the Graphic that is part of this news article.
"President Obama’s executive action plans may allow up to five million immigrants in the United States illegally to stay and obtain work permits.
An analysis by the Migration Policy Institute estimates how many people would be affected by the changes."

I do not happen to support this intention. However it should be reported as accurately as possible and not misconstrued by anyone.
The word "amnesty" is a hot button issue and it should not be pressed needlessly and in a reckless manner.

Sure, let's deport the 11 million.  Put 100 on a bus, 10 buses a day.  That's 1000/day, which is unrealistic already.  But at that rate, it will take 11,000 days to deport them all.  That's 30 years, folks.  Has anyone even thought about that?
Absolutely. If the law is not enforced now there will be no end to more illegals. Eventually the next Ferguson will be based on a black  policeman shooting an Hispanic, and then watch cities burn.

No one understands the meaning of the word illegal.  No one is ever held accountable or is punished because they broke the law.  It is not a nation of laws.  Young adults learn there is nothing to fear from breaking the law, often you are glamorized and receive benefits.  Certainly those crossing our borders fear nothing.

' Immigrants and their relatives, of course, have been waiting for legislation by congress or the WH to bring relief.'
If they want 'relief' from their illegal residency, they can return to their home countries with their families and enjoy the tax free wages they earned here and use the free public educations their kids got to make those countries better.

What do the polls say about immigration reform? There are some ways to gauge the opinions of the American people regarding this issue. From what I can glean from writings, opinions, comments, and such - a good deal of 'politically correct' BS is going on: people want to appear generous and caring, but when the chips fall, and action may be imminent - many of them actually are opposed to the president's proposed action to solve the immigration problem. Immigrants and their relatives, of course, have been waiting for legislation by congress or the WH to bring relief. President Obama has promised to do that, by executive action since after many requests, John Boehner, Speaker of the House can't bring it to a vote, and has stalled it for 17 months, even as the senate has done their job. He would rather face the 'disapproval' of the president and the people, rather than to face another revolt from his caucus.

Executive actions - performed many times by the president's predecessors - is deemed "unconstitutional" if the president acts. To date, there has been no definitive word on whether this is true or not. - not from media or scholars. A NYT editorial recently advised him to forcefully take it on. Who do we believe?

Even in light of The Law Suit, threats of impeachment, gov't shutdowns and the like, the president wants to press ahead, and I certainly agree. But it is obvious to me that many Americans are opposed - they give lip-service. A sad reflection of us as a nation.

If the US Constitution: Article 1, Section 8, "Naturalization laws are delegated to Congress" is now optional per the actions of the President, the entire US Constitution is optional.  If the President of the United States can evade the law without consequence, no American should be held accountable to the rule of law.  I welcome our new found freedom.

59% of the non elderly on Medicaid (Medi-Cal), 54% on Food Stamps in California are Hispanic. And I heard on NPR a couple of weeks ago that fully half of all kids born in California now are on Medicaid (Medi-Cal).

California is now a state with a prosperous coast and a third world interior.

Given our lack of enforcement of existing law, our de facto policy with respect to immigration is that we have an open border. Every ten years or so, we decide to grant legal status to another 5 to 10 million people, most of whom are uneducated and poor and make significant demands on social services.

Do we really want to keep on doing this? Can we afford to keep on doing this?
The right to work for low wages, "off the book."  Great deal for the farmers who employ them. And the beauty is there is an endless supply willing to work for very little.

Homeostasis: "a relatively stable state of equilibrium or a tendency toward such a state between the different but interdependent elements or groups of elements of an organism, population, or group" (Webster's)

This applies to physical objects as well as social groups. With the exception of mass genocide emergencies, opening a floodgate will turn the U.S. into South America rather than helping South Americans become part of the U.S.

Those commenters here latching on only to cigarettes as the cause for this civil uprising have missed the essence of the article. The citizens of Westminster correctly have see that what is at stake is not cigarettes, but our civil liberties.

I for one, "militant" non-smoker that I am, am proud of Westminster and its people.

You use parents in the plural, today it seems you should be blaming the parent. The constant decent of generational decay. Too many people today believe they will never be wrong and therefore anything they dislike is inherently wrong. This mindset in the political mindset is why the big picture is missed all too often. The economy, our infrastructure, even the simple application and enforcement of current laws should be focused on rather than expanding into more frivolous laws. I get smoking is not a favorable habit, but will we go on to banning rap music too? I really hate that but you don't see me making a campaign for its condemnation.

"Now when I drink it, I find it revolting. "

Good for you.

"I'm surprised at the intensity of feeling, on behalf of readers who seem to lack any interest in science,"
Saying that one enjoys drinking milk does not equate to a "lack any interest in science". Sheesh. How absurd.

Re avoiding fat - PBS recently aired a program wherein they showed that the calcium in milk and cheese actually helped flush fat out of the system by encapsulating it. (I can't recall the exact name of the program - something like "10 myths about weight loss. " )

I used to drink lots of milk, especially when I was pregnant and nursing babies.  I quit drinking it regularly about a dozen years ago, as research started to show it did not protect against osteoporosis.   Now when I drink it, I find it revolting.  I've lost the taste for it.  I still enjoy cheese, but limit that because of trying to avoid fat.  I'm surprised at the intensity of feeling, on behalf of readers who seem to lack any interest in science, and concurrently seem to attach a political fervor to the act of drinking milk.  Sheesh.  How dull.

The more restricted our civil liberties become, the more power the corporations and the military, which effectively already own the government, will have.
So, yes, we are already living in advanced nanny state. The trick is to make sure that the children, i.e. The people, cannot be allowed to grow up and think for themselves. Every day I see more and more people who have already switched off their brains and given up their free will. Fortunately, the people of Westminster are not among them.
We die from just living.

@ JMD

Not for me, I moved to Canada, where one of our pleasures is enjoying Cuban beaches.

BTW, I'm originally from Puerto Rico, which American tourists have made unsavoury. THAT is the "outrage."

I'm all for the ban on American travel to Cuba.
Don't confuse crony capitalism with free market.  The ACA is crony capitalism, bordering on fascism (fascism is the rule of the government partly through monopoly, government favored companies).
No Republican voted for this.  Not one.  And the execution of government policy through government favored and empowered corporations is not free market, it is called fascism.
Trust me, you don't want to be treated by an emergency room doctor in the UK.

Insurance companies did not have a vote either, but they are who Obama chose to negotiate with, rather than with Republicans.  When Obama says it is the best deal he could get, and he did not get (or need) the vote of a single Republican in either House of Congress to get a deal, then obviously he is speaking of a deal with insurance companies.  What leverage do those companies have, since they vote?  They and their trial lawyer allies are the financial backers of most Democrat candidates.  Follow the money.

Having passed three score and ten earlier this year, survived a hip prosthesis revision, prostate cancer, diverticulitis, amongst other things I couldn't agree more. Walking at least fifteen miles a week for most of the last ten years probably helped my heart, but it probably led to the need for the prosthesis  revision.

Nice of Mr. Jens Reich to recall Czech authors, Vaclav Havel (the late president0 and Milan Kundera (who remains in exile in France).

Just finished our one year in Berlin: Very positive experience at so many levels, especially for us "connoisseurs" of the Cold War, where division of Germany, starting with that awful, inhuman Berlin Wall, was not only a symbol but brutal reality. For too many years.

I am confident that Berlin and Germany will continue to do well and even serve as a good example how to succeed in global competition.

Does anyone really believe that the world's leaders--of both poor and rich nations--are going to stop corporations from their current course of destruction for profit in order to protect the environment for future generations? Given the current trajectory of population growth and use of non-renewable energy, any action that will be taken will be too little to late. Human activity will continue to destroy the environment on which our health and our lives depend.
